intro: Ammannia passerinoides, commonly known as redroot pigweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its reddish stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ammannia passerinoides is often considered a weed but can serve as a food source for certain insects and wildlife.
